answers.answer: Try using a penis health creme containing acetyl L carnitine (great supplement for sensitivity issues).  A good creme containing all natural ingredients will work wonders for your skin down there.  And since it is all natural, you won't have to worry about side effects.  Good luck.

question: I'm am 24-years old, and about 4 years ago I noticed that I had lost sensation in the shaft of my penis. The strange thing was the way it happened: I was lying down in bed, I woke up, and suddenly the sensation was gone. I could still get an erection and orgasm just fine, but I couldn't really feel anything during masturbation or intercourse.I went to see both a urologist and neurologist, and the results showed nothing was wrong with me psychically.Also, about a year ago, I noticed that there was a loss of the relaxing sensation you get when urinating. There was a decrease of the sensation of pleasure in the pit of my stomach when sexually stimulated. It has also affected how hard I laugh, if that makes any sense,About 6 weeks ago I went back to the urologist for a second opinion, and the results were the same. He gave me some Viagra, but it hasn't helped me get any of the feeling back, so he suggested that I see a psychiatrist to make sure that my problem isn't all in my head.I don't smoke or do any recreational drugs, and I didn't start drinking at this point, nor do I have diabetes or take any medications.Does anyone have any suggestions on what could be wrong with me?
title: loss of penile senation
